body_html:
We wouldn't have been able to deploy 1.11 if the absl headers hadn't been included in the pip package or the headers hadn't been supported by Bazel.

Note that this problem appears to be isolated to non-Bazel builds so far (the OP is running g++, RPi uses a Makefile, cmake is cmake, and I'm not sure what @lauriebyrum was using to build on iOS). Possibly there is something missing from TF's configure script or cmake scripts (like @beweinreich's header include) because our builds only test (and we only officially support) Bazel.

body:
We wouldn't have been able to deploy 1.11 if the absl headers hadn't been included in the pip package or the headers hadn't been supported by Bazel.

Note that this problem appears to be isolated to non-Bazel builds so far (the OP is running g++, RPi uses a Makefile, cmake is cmake, and I'm not sure what @lauriebyrum was using to build on iOS). Possibly there is something missing from TF's configure script or cmake scripts (like @beweinreich's header include) because our builds only test (and we only officially support) Bazel.
